definition: to act stupid/to pretend to be naive
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
foolish

sentences.english: Don't play dumb, I know that you ate the last piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 别装傻了，我知道是你吃了最后一块蛋糕。

sentences.english: Michael plays dumb, replying “Never heard of the guy.”
sentences.chinese: “Michael装傻充愣，“从没听说过这家伙”。

sentences.english: Don't play dumb, I know you ate the last piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 别装傻了，我知道是你吃了最后一块蛋糕。

sentences.english: I play the fool, you and I covered up the story.
sentences.chinese: 我装傻，掩盖了我和你的故事。

sentences.english: He always likes to play the fool.
Don't play dumb , nigger. You know who this is. You got my money?
sentences.chinese: 别装傻黑鬼你知道我是谁你拿到钱了吗？

sentences.english: I know that you ate the last piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 别装傻了，我知道是你吃了最后一块蛋糕。

sentences.english: You say dreams are dreams. I ain't gonna play the fool anymore.
sentences.chinese: 你说，梦想就是梦想，我不打算再装傻下去了。

to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
to play deaf-mute
to play stupid/to act like an idiot
foolish
duplicity/hypocrisy (idiom)
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
great intelligence may appear to be stupidity (idiom)
to pretend/to feign/to act a part
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion

to feign/to pretend
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
